fig.title: I'm Starting a Startup! (Image from: biznes.warmia.mazury.pl)

conbody.p: Yes, the day has finally come to shout it out to everyone, or at least let your family and friends know, that you've got a brilliant idea and you're diving into business. You're starting a startup! It will be a unicorn, definitely yes! Youâ€™ll be like Elon Musk or Mark Zuckerberg... some basement or garage will also be found... You can already picture the investors and customers lining up for your product, competitors in tears, fame, and glamour... WHOA, WHOA... hold your horses.

To make all that a reality, you need knowledge, a plan, time, and a fair bit of honest self-reflection. This guide will help you get a grasp of what a startup is, its pros and cons, the qualities you need as a founder, the steps to take, and the methods available.
It's a long journey from an idea to a product, so grab a notebook and let's dive into this guide together.

note.p:
Ladies, I've used the male form to simplify communication. This isn't just by chance... The statistics aren't in our favour when it comes to founding startups. Research shows that the two most common types of founders are men:
Young startup founder (20-40 years old), who has:
Old startup founder (>40 years old), who has:
a positive attitude
openness to cooperation with others
ability to set goals
not afraid to ask for feedback
experience in marketing and sales
project management skills
ability to select people for the team
knowledge of how to raise money for investments

conbody.p: Trends, like everything else, change. There are more and more women stepping up, but knowledge stays neutral. So, let's take this journey together.
